item.title: Portal help
item.dc:creator: @playermanny2 playermanny2
item.description:
@playermanny2 wrote:

[quote=“o.O O.o, post:4, topic:148324”]objectX and Y would be the coords of the global object you added.

I’d suggest using 2 different cases for 2 different portals, unless it’s the same ID. You could just use another ID so you can use 2 cases with basic teleing.[/quote]

alreayd answered that

omfgbbqsauce:

Okay and what is //object 1 could i just put //portal and //portal2

yea you can you want

Read full topic

item.title: Portal help
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

objectX and Y would be the coords of the global object you added.

I’d suggest using 2 different cases for 2 different portals, unless it’s the same ID. You could just use another ID so you can use 2 cases with basic teleing.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal help
item.dc:creator: @omfgbbqsauce omfgbbqsauce
item.description:
@omfgbbqsauce wrote:

Case ####: //object id if (objectX == #### && objectY == ####) { //object 1 teleportToX = X coords; teleportToY = Y coords; sendMessage("This is the first portal"); } if (objectX == #### && objectY == ####) { teleportToX = X coords; teleportToY = Y coords; sendMessage("Portal 2, use this method to add more than one portal same case number"); } break;

Heres a code to make more than 1 portal but I dont get this part if (objectX == #### && objectY == ####) { //object 1

what would i put for objectx and y then object1?

Read full topic
